commit_message:
Add nova support ironic instance port group network metadata spec

The feature aims at providing complete network information to help create an
ironic server instance that supports bond functionality with multiple network
cards.

blueprint nova-support-ironic-instance-port-group-network-metadata
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/nova-support-ironic-instance-port-group-network-metadata

Change-Id: If430cf4b2221f97bcd639dbc2e2bb48bbc704ccc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/44/779644/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================================================== Nova support ironic instance port group network metadata ======================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/nova-support-ironic-instance-port-group-network-metadata The feature aims at providing complete network information to help create an ironic server instance that supports bond functionality with multiple network cards. Problem description =================== 'network_data.json' in ConfigDriveDatasource contains port group information which provides ports with bond functionality. When an instance starts, cloud-init will use these data to configure ports automatically. However, when using OpenstackDatasource, 'network_data.json' dose not contain port group information. After starting, ironic instance which set up with bond functionality with multiple network cards will not able to configure network ports correctly. Use Cases --------- Bare metal machine that supports bond functionality with multiple network cards, which is configured to use the OpenStack data source provided by Nova-API-Metadata service to obtain network configuration information. Proposed change =============== Changes on nova-api-metadata service. For ironic server instance that supports bond functionality with multiple network cards, metadata service has to provide port group information. One API is involved -- "http://169.254.169.254/openstack/latest/network_data.json". - 1. Add a function to tell whether a instance is an ironic instance based on flavor and instance.node. 1) The basic step is to check flavor. Find in the extra_specs of flavor, checking whether the keys exists that starts with "resources:CUSTOM_". If exists, then the instance may be an ironic instance. 2) After passing the basic checking, we need to get all compute_nodes through cell_mappings. Search nodes that hypervisor_hostname or uuid equals instance.node. Check whether the queried instance's hypervisor type is 'ironic'. - 2. Add a function to generate ironic instance network metadata, which comes from the original network metadata and port group information. This function receives node_uuid and the original network metadata. It uses ironicclient to call node.list_ports and portgroup.list. Afterwards, combine network metadata with ports and portgroup to generate the new network metadata with bond information. - 3. In nova/api/metadata/base.py:__init__ function before generating network metadata, we need to do some modification for ironic instance. * First, call the function referred in (1) to tell whether the instance is an ironic instance. If true, load the IronicClientWrapper. If fails, it means ironicclient is not installed. * If ironicclient exits, call the function referred in (2) to generate the new network metadata with bond information. Alternatives ------------ Use ConfigDrive as data source. Data model impact ----------------- Original network metadata example of network_data.json: .. code-block:: json { "links": [ { "id": "tap81915c7b-99", "vif_id": "81915c7b-9902-4df8-b840-0575b1497621", "type": "phy", "mtu": 1500, "ethernet_mac_address": "b4:05:5d:15:f9:3e" } ], "networks": [ { "id": "network0", "type": "ipv4_dhcp", "link": "tap81915c7b-99", "netuork_id": "7czc6b3-d6eb-Ac8d-Bae4-f630a218748d" }, ], "services": [] } New network metadata example of network_data.json with bond messages: .. code-block:: json { "links": [ { "id": "tap81915c7b-99", "vif_id": "81915c7b-9902-4df8-b840-057561497621", "type": "bond", "mtu": 1500, "ethernet_mac_address": "b4:05:5d:i5:f9:3e", "bond_mode": "active-backup", "bond_links": [ "038f035a-31ca-488e-abf3b-24c45c25920e", "32da47cc-ddee-4983-9ea34-68Za0d8369aa" ], "bond_miimon": 100 }, { "id": "038f035a-31ca-488e-abf3b-24c45c25920e", "type": "phy", "ethernet_mac_address": "b4:05:5d:15:f9:3e" }, { "id": "32da47cc-ddee-4983-9ea34-68Za0d8369aa", "type": "phy", "ethernet_mac_address": "b4:05:5d:15:f9:3f" } ], "networks": [ { "id": "network0", "type": "ipv4_dhcp", "1ink": "tap819i5c7b-99", "network_id": "27c2c6b3-d6eb-4c8d-aee4-f630a218748d" } ], "services": [] } REST API impact --------------- Response of network_data.json. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ For most scenarios, a server instance is not typically an ironic instance, so the main performance factor is the ability to quickly determine if a server is an ironic instance. Using extra_specs information in instance.flavor can quickly filter out most of the instance that are not ironic instances with little performance impact. In the further judgment of ironic instances, there will be reading table of cell_mappings and compute_node in every cell in the worst case. Generally, the number of cells is small. In The worst, value of database read operand is the number of cell_mappings + 1, which has a little impact on performance. Finally, when it comes to generate portGroup data for an ironic instance, loading a client module and making two calls will have a performance impact and take a long time relatively. Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Upgrade impact -------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: zhangjl02 Other contributors: jiangfw Feature Liaison --------------- Feature Liaison: zhangjl02 Work Items ---------- * Update content in network_data.json of OpenstackDatasource Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Add related unit test for ironic server instance that supports bond functionality with multiple network cards. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== .. '}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-12 10:34:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs/commit/8096684a9a592055c142dad6e1ced07bb2580105', 'message': 'Adds spec for Hyper-V instance hot resize

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/hyper-v-hot-resize

In Windows Hyper-V / Server 2012 R2 a new feature was introduced,
allowing users to resize the VMs while they are still running.
Because of this, no down time for the spawned instances is
necessary when performing nova resize.

Change-Id: Ic7b798da05ba89958b46f6e3f32ea1e788b6288e
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-12-12 13:45:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs/commit/d2c8b62ed4d07980d18b5c6ff499cbdc70744ec6', 'message': 'Adds spec for Hyper-V instance hot resize

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/hyper-v-hot-resize

In Windows Hyper-V / Server 2012 R2 a new feature was introduced,
allowing users to resize both memory and local disks (but not vCPUs)
of the VMs while they are still running. Because of this,
no down time for the spawned instances is necessary when
nova resize is performed on the same host.

Implements: blueprint hyper-v-hot-resize

Change-Id: Ic7b798da05ba89958b46f6e3f32ea1e788b6288e
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2015-03-17 23:08:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs/commit/d131594072d0e4947ad592aa3855940eb751a396', 'message': 'Adds spec for instance live resize

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/instance-live-resize

Hyper-V, KVM, VMWare and Xen allows users to resize both memory
and local disks of the VMs while they are still running. Because
of this, no down time is needed for the spawned instances when
live resize is performed on the same host.

Implements: blueprint instance-live-resize

commit_message:
Adds spec for instance live resize

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/instance-live-resize

Hyper-V, KVM, PowerVM and VMWare allows users to resize both memory
and local disks of the VMs while they are still running. Because
of this, no down time is needed for the spawned instances when
live resize is performed on the same host.

APIImpact

Implements: blueprint instance-live-resize

Change-Id: Ic7b798da05ba89958b46f6e3f32ea1e788b6288e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/19/141219/40 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Hyper-V: Instance hot resize ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/hyper-v-hot-resize In Windows Hyper-V / Server 2012 R2 a new feature was introduced, allowing users to resize the VMs while they are still running. Because of this, no down time for the spawned instances is necessary when performing nova resize. Problem description =================== The main disadvantage for resizing an instance is the required down time necessary to do so. This spec will allow users to resize their Hyper-V instances without having to stop them first. Use Cases ---------- There are 2 use cases, depending on what OS the nova-compute service is running: * Windows Hyper-V / Server 2012 R2: only the virtual hard disk hot resize is supported. This means that this feature is only appliable if the new target flavor requires only a bigger disk. Cold resize will be performed in any other cases. For more details, check the source [1]. * Windows Hyper-V / Server 10 Technical Preview or newer: only virtual hard disk and memory hot resize are supported. Cold resize will be performed if the flavor requires a different number of vCPUs. For more details, check the source [2]. There are a few restrictions that apply to this feature, as mentioned in [1]: * The disk format must be VHDX. * The disk to be resized must be attached to a SCSI controller. * The resize must occur on the same host. Project Priority ----------------- None Proposed change =============== There are a few changes that needs to be applied to the Hyper-V driver in order to support this feature: * Attach the virtual hard disks to the SCSI controller instead of the IDE controller. * Add virtual hard disk online resize support to a subclass of VHDUtilsV2, which will be used in Windows Hyper-V / Server 2012 R2 or newer. * Add support for memory resize in a subclass of VMUtilsV2, which will be used in Windows Hyper-V / Server 10 Technical Preview or newer. * Add the appropriate changes to utilsfactory to accommodate the new utils classes mentioned above. Since hot resize can only occur if the host stays the same, we must check that it is truly the case and the new flavor is appropriate for a hot resize. Cold resize is to be applied otherwise, meaning there would be no change in functionality. If a hot resize is appropriate, during resize, the Hyper-V driver must: * migrate_disk_and_power_off: *Avoid stoping and destroying the instance. * finish_migration: * Avoid creating another ephemeral disk. * Avoid creating a new instance and attaching a config drive to it, since it was never destroyed. * Avoid starting the instance, since it was never stoped. * Perform hot resize. * finish_revert_migration: * Avoid creating a new instance and attaching a config drive to it, since it was never destroyed. * Avoid starting the instance, since it was never stoped. If hot resize is appropriate, the following changes to ComputeManager's resize_instance method should be considered: * It should not terminate the connection for any of the instance's volumes, since they are still in use and the instance can actively use them. * Since the resize occurs on the same host, avoid calling finish_resize through compute_rpcapi and call the method locally. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None, the user will use the same command as before. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- To use this feature, the users will have to enable it from the compute node's nova.conf, setting the config option hyperv.allow_live_resize‏ to True. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <cbelu@cloudbasesolutions.com> Work Items ---------- Work items or tasks -- break the feature up into the things that need to be done to implement it. Those parts might end up being done by different people, but we're mostly trying to understand the timeline for implementation. Dependencies ============ * Windows Hyper-V / Server 2012 R2 (hot resize - disk only) * Windows Hyper-V / Server 10 Technical Preview (hot resize - disk + memory) Testing ======= This feature should have the unit tests related to the any changes. CI testing will be performed by Hyper-V CI. Documentation Impact ==================== The possibility to perform hot resize on Hyper-V instances will be documented, as well as the config option for Hyper-V. References ========== [1] http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn282286.aspx [2] http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn765471.aspx#BKMK_hot

commit_message:
Remove RPC call to ensure volume attachment successful

This blueprint proposes to remove the RPC call in nova API to avoid attaching
volumes failures when attaching multiple volumes to an instance simultaneously
with a slow volume backend.

Part of blueprint ensure-volume-attachment-successful

Co-Authored-By: Brin Zhang <zhangbailin@inspur.com>
Co-Authored-By: Lee Yarwood <lyarwood@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I7523f994f5b393e056ae9820927159d548dbbdba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/20/758920/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================================= Add instance_state to ensure volume attachment successful ========================================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/ensure-volume-attachment-successful This blueprint proposes to add task state to void attaching volumes continuous fail. And which will prevent the user to attach another volume when the previous volume not attaching completely. Problem description =================== If the user want to attach volumes continuously, there will be a problem when the first volume attached too slowly. Because if the first volume attached too slowly, and at the same time attaching another volume, the nova-api will send the RPC call message to nova-cpu, however the attach_volume function in manager.py[1] is taking an instance.uuid lock for the first volume, and reserve_block_device_name function in manager.py[1] will wait the first volume attached completed to take the instance.uuid lock to create block_device_mapping. And if storage backend is dealt with attaching slowly, the RPC call in nova-api will be timeout. The nova-cpu does not know the nova-api has excepted caused by timeout, and still to create block_device_mapping after the first volume attached completely. And the database will has a record for the second volume, though the volume is not attached to this instance. Use Cases --------- As an operator, I wants to attach more than one volumes, it will be useful to avoid errors during attaching volumes. Proposed change =============== Define ATTACHING and DETACHING in fields.py and task_state.py Check the task state is none or not, if the task state is not none, there will be not allowed to attach and detach the volume and return the HTTP conflict. Save ATTACHING to the task state before creating block_device_mapping and save the task state to none when exception occurs in _attach_volume function in nova-api. Save the DETACHING to the task state and save the task state to none when exception occurs in detach_volume function in nova-api. Save the task state to None when the attaching process is over in nova-cpu. and call the decorator function when the exception is raised. Save the task state to None when the detaching process is over in nova-cpu. and call the decorator function when the exception is raised. Code implementation can be found in [2] [3] Alternatives ------------ We could always create the bdm in the nova-api and update the device once attached on the compute. This is a good method to avoid the problem as the above mentioned, but this method cannot guarantee to get the right device name very well. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- This is only for nova-api and nova-cpu, no impact for others. Upgrade impact -------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Jorhson Deng <dengzhaosen@inspur.com> Work Items ---------- None Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * New unit test should be added Documentation Impact ==================== * Document need to be changed to describe this feature. References ========== .. [1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/manager.py .. [2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/754258/ .. [3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/758918/ History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Wallaby - Introduced

commit_message:
Add nova-support-multiple-boot-volume-with-boot-order-selection spec

Spec for blueprint: nova support multiple-boot-volume with boot order selection
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/nova-multiple-boot-volume-selection

Change use cases description.

Change-Id: I1254d68fd6845be983e6935c9fac73ba7d7430ed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/97/737897/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =========================================================== Nova support multiple boot volume with boot order selection =========================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/nova-support-multiple-boot-volume-with-boot-order-selection This feature aims at providing the ability to change boot order of a instance virtualized by qemu with multiple bootable volumes. End user can bind several volumes to an instance and choose a different volume to boot the instance when necessary. The changes take effect and reboot immediately if "reboot" optional set to "true" or after hard rebooting manually. Problem description =================== QEMU has supported for boot index but this feature is not included in nova now. Although block device mapping has recorded the boot index information, it is not used adequately. Now, an implementation for boot order selection will provide a easy way to boot an instance with several volumes. Use Cases --------- End user can change a different volume to boot the instance, which is like changing operating system in a vm. This feature can be used to help to rescue system with a backup system volume or else. Also end user can choose to start a Windows OS server, then switch to Linux OS after attaching a linux bootable volume to server. Proposed change =============== * RESTful API for changing and querying boot order will be added to nova-api. Save the new boot index information to databases, and update server's root device and root device size. If user set the reboot option to true, then a hard rebooting invoking will be made. * Changes will be patched to nova-compute when generating guest xml. Multiple boot support will be used when os boot device is 'hd', and this os element will be removed. Afterwards, boot order information will be written into the guest's config based on guest's block device information. Then the server will boot from the volume as arranged. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- Two API methods are added: Update volume boot order API and Query volume boot order API: * URL: /servers/{server_id}/volume-boot-order Update volume boot order API, and Query volume boot order API * Method type: * PUT(Update volume boot order) * GET( Query volume boot order) * Normal http response code(s): 202 for update, 200 for query * Expected error http response code(s):400, 404, 409 * Error code explanation: * 400: The request body is not in valid format or block device information dose not match with instance. * 409: New flavor can not be created while root device size changed. * 404: Request server is not found * Request body for PUT method :: { "server": { "block_device_mapping_v2": [ { "boot_index": 1, "uuid": "volume_id_1" }, { "boot_index": 2, "uuid": "volume_id_2" } ], "reboot": true } } * The "uuid" is uuid of volume attached to the server, which id referred to block_device_mapping_v2_new_item schema. * The "boot_index" is a positive integer. * The "reboot" is optional, and the default value is false. If it is set true, server will hard reboot. * For GET method, body content is blank. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- If "reboot" is set, hard reboot notification will be sent. Other end user impact --------------------- Aside from the API, python-novaclient can be patched to support this feature afterwards. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- The "virt_type" property is recommend to set kvm or qemu in the "nova.conf" to support this feature. Developer impact ---------------- If the feature is on, guest's xml definition will be a little different. "boot order" will be added to the disk element of devices, and "boot dev" will be removed from the "os" element if the original value is calculated as "hd". Newly attached volume's boot index will be 'None', which will be at the bottom of block mapping list. Therefore this won't have an impact on volume attachment or detachment. Upgrade impact -------------- The feature can be support support by libvirt since 0.1.3, per-device boot since 0.8.8. We tested on Rocky release, and the boot order can be successfully changed. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Jinsheng Zhang Other contributors: fangwen Feature Liaison --------------- Liaison Needed Work Items ---------- * nova-api: add "update boot order" and "query boot order" API. Check and save block device mappings, then call remote compute service to hard reboot the server. * nova-compute: reboot the server. Set boot order according to the block device mapping when generating guest's xml. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Add releated unit test. Documentation Impact ==================== * `API Guides` needs some updates in #Servers - run an action #, add volume boot order selection API. * `Configuration Reference` & `Deployment Guides` need some updates. When compute nodes is qemu as hypervisor, "virt_type" is recommended to set in controller node. References ========== https://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsDisks History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Rocky - Introduced

commit_message:
Offline Reshape tool spec

Spec for implementing bp offline-reshape-tool

Change-Id: If66dc02ba8baf7859e4984a2a044f9ebadb26196
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/08/742908/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================================== Offline reshape tool for Placement =================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/offline-reshape-tool At the moment, reshapes are done by the compute service when restarting it after an upgrade. Given fast forward upgrades don't restart services until the last release, Nova needs to continue to support reshapes for old releases, like Stein. If we want to delete old reshapes upstream (and not checking the needed behaviours everytime we restart nova-compute), we need to provide a specific command (eg. a nova-manage) command that would verify and modify the Placement DB without needing to have the services to be up, ie. an offline tool per say. Problem description =================== Use Cases --------- * As a developer, I want to delete old reshape methods * As an operator, I just don't want to see the compute service to verify all the reshapes since Stein if I just have a simple upgrade. Proposed change =============== Since the `nova-manage` command directly queries the Nova databases without needing the services to be up, it's needed to use it from a host that can look at the DB. That said, since most of the reshape methods are used for virtual drivers like Libvirt, the command should also be run in the needed compute hosts. As we can't ask operators to make sure that compute hosts can query the Placement DB, we then need to provide two different commands : * one for querying the Placement DB directly * one for running in the compute host and checking the virt drvers The first one should be the main command for reshaping. It would use some file created by the second command and would ask the Placement API to reshape the needed allocations. The second command would be run in every compute host to get a new provider tree. The relationship between those two commands could be seen as very similar as the overall flow we have for `online reshapes`_ : * In the compute host, the operator would call ``nova-manage compute update_provider_tree``. If the return code is 1, then the related resource provider for the compute host would be needed to be reshaped. If it returns 0, no reshape is needed. * Then, the operator would run on a controller host ``nova-manage placement get_allocations <rp_uuid>`` to get all the allocations from the specific Resource Provider UUID that is actually the related compute host. * Then, back to the compute host, the operator would call ``nova-manage compute update_provider_tree <file>`` where <file> is the file provided by the previous call. It would then return the new provider tree. * Eventually, running on the controller host ``nova-manage placement reshape <file>`` where <file> would be what was returned would need call Placement API to ask to reshape. Some diagram could be better for understanding the workflow : .. seqdiag:: seqdiag { edge_length = 200; span_height = 15; activation = none; default_note_color = white; 'Compute host'; Controller; 'Compute host' -> 'Compute host' [label = "nova-manage compute update_provider_tree"]; 'Controller' -> 'Controller' [label = "nova-manage placement get_allocations <rp_uuid>"]; 'Controller' -> 'Compute host' [label = "<file or stream>"]; 'Compute host' -> 'Compute host' [label = "nova-manage compute update_provider_tree <file>"]; 'Compute host' -> 'Controller' [label = "<file or stream>"]; 'Controller' -> 'Controller' [label = "nova-manage placement reshape <file>"]; } Direct Interface to Placement ----------------------------- To make the ``nova-manage placement`` commands possible, we need to make placement accessible by importing Python code rather than as a standalone service. The quickest path forward is to use `wsgi-intercept`_ to allow HTTP interactions, using the `requests`_ library, to work with only database traffic going over the network. This allows client code to make changes to the placement data store using the same API, but without running a placement service. An implementation of this, as a context manager called `PlacementDirect`_, is merged. The context manager accepts an `oslo config`_, populated by the caller. This allows the calling code to control how it wishes to discover configuration settings, most importantly the database being used by placement. This implementation provides a quick solution to the immediate needs of offline use of `Placement POST /reshaper`_ while allowing options for prettier solutions in the future. Compute upgrade Script ---------------------- Since libvirt won't be running, the compute upgrade scripts are responsible for querying status of instances by directly looking up the domains. We may refer to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/501025/ for an example of an upgrade script that requires a virt driver. Alternatives ------------ Direct Placement ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Alternatives to the ``wsgi-intercept`` model for the `Direct Interface to Placement`_: * Directly access the object methods (with some refactoring/cleanup). Rejected because we lose things like schema validation and microversion logic. * Create cleaner, pythonic wrappers around those object methods. Rejected (in the short term) for the sake of expediency. We might take this approach longer-term as/when the demand for direct placement expands beyond FFU scripting. * Use ``wsgi-intercept`` but create the pythonic wrappers outside of the REST layer. This is also a long-term option. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- None. Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- See `Upgrade Impact`_. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- None. Upgrade impact -------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: bauzas Feature Liaison --------------- bauzas Work Items ---------- See `Proposed change`_. Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= Functional test. Documentation Impact ==================== * nova-manage documentation References ========== * `nova-manage db`_ migration helper docs * `wsgi-intercept`_ * Python `requests`_ * `PlacementDirect`_ implementation * `oslo config`_ library * `online reshapes`_ spec * `Placement POST /reshaper`_ API .. _`nova-manage db`: https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/cli/nova-manage.html#nova-database .. _wsgi-intercept: https://pypi.org/project/wsgi_intercept/ .. _requests: http://docs.python-requests.org/ .. _PlacementDirect: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572576/ .. _oslo config: https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.config/latest/ .. _`online reshapes`: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/stein/approved/reshape-provider-tree.html#proposed-change .. _`Placement POST /reshaper`: https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/placement/#reshaper

commit_message:
Migrate from testr to stestr

* Replace .testr.conf by .stestr.conf for migration and update
  .gitignore and test-requirements.txt file accordingly
* Use py3 as the default runtime for tox and 3.18.0 as the
  minversion for tox
* Add a new job, openstack-cover-jobs, to run the coverage in Zuul

Signed-off-by: HeroicHitesh <email.hiteshkumar@gmail.com>

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of
dash-separated options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported
in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores.
Without this, we see 'UserWarning' messages
like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I2df0f4f2dc34794517befe75b27ed86a4ade90a2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/80/791080/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add config-drive in parameter_defaults

We added support to explicitly request config-drive
for BMC and Undercloud type instances in [1]. Default
is false.

Adding similiar option in parameter_defaults will ease overriding
environments/base.yaml in ovb-manage role generate_template.yml[2].

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-virtual-baremetal/commit/306ec29aec8a716e49cf0fd70e240aea8c7dc1d7
[2] https://github.com/rdo-infra/review.rdoproject.org-config/blob/master/roles/ovb-manage/tasks/generate_template.yml#L13

Change-Id: I7bbdc80684147c72561c0434b3217e41bd2a0995
(cherry picked from commit b58913d865aa67fca78a73d22284778ba75f9a42)

commit_message:
Revert "Refactor OVN bridge MAC addresses"

This reverts commit a120ada72e05a380616755d514a4bc81ea7ef227.

Reason for revert: This introduces an issue if OVNStaticBridgeMacMappings
is not defined. This is a new requirement that is not
user/developer friendly. I don't think we should have
to provide this manually.

Change-Id: I51d27a0150ddab885b4cc9f0373b1030608b4dba
Related-Bug: #1927556

commit_message:
Add config-drive in parameter_defaults

We added support to explicitly request config-drive
for BMC and Undercloud type instances in [1]. Default
is false.

Adding similiar option in parameter_defaults will ease overriding
environments/base.yaml in ovb-manage role generate_template.yml[2].

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-virtual-baremetal/commit/306ec29aec8a716e49cf0fd70e240aea8c7dc1d7
[2] https://github.com/rdo-infra/review.rdoproject.org-config/blob/master/roles/ovb-manage/tasks/generate_template.yml#L13

Change-Id: I7bbdc80684147c72561c0434b3217e41bd2a0995

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

commit_message:
Raise maximum allowed secret size

The default maximum allowed size is too small for some certificates.
This patch doubles the allowed size from 10Kb to 20Kb, and raises the
maximum request size by the same amount.

Change-Id: I59d11c5c9c32128ab9d71eaecdf46dd2d789a8d1
(cherry picked from commit c59f2a6bbb83308de1598cebdc82197f2a148c6b)

(cherry picked from kolla commit abc4f7c124265f9e7b72d448b2ef18d6d4e84888)

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/56/777356/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ============ Code Reviews ============ All Kolla code must be reviewed and approved before it can be merged. Anyone with a Gerrit account is able to provide a review. Two labels are available to everyone: * +1: Approve * -1: Changes requested It is also possible to leave comments without a label. In general, a review with comments is more valuable. Comments are especially important for a negative review. Prefer quality of reviews over quantity. You can watch specific patches in Gerrit via *Settings -> Watched Projects*. The volume of emails is not too large if you subscribe to *New Changes* only. If you do not have much time available for reviewing, consider reviewing patches in an area that is important to you or that you understand well. Core reviewers ============== Core reviewers have additional labels available to them. * +2: Approve * -2: Do not merge * Workflow +1: Approve and ready for merge Zuul requires one +2 and one workflow +1, as well as a passing check, in order for a patch to proceed to the gate. The Kolla team generally requires two +2s before a workflow +1 may be added. We also have some non-voting Zuul jobs which will not block a check, but should be investigated if they are failing. Core reviewers may still use +1 to indicate approval if they are not confident enough about a particular patch to use +2. The Kolla core reviewers have the same rights of access to stable branches, so always check the branch for a review, and use extra care with stable branches. Becoming a core reviewer ------------------------ There are no strict rules for becoming a core reviewer. Join the community, review some patches, and demonstrate responsibility, understanding & care. If you are interested in joining the core team, ask the PTL or another core reviewer how to get there.

commit_message:
baremetal: Don't start Docker after install on Debian/Ubuntu

docker-ce on Debian/Ubuntu gets started just after installation, before
baremetal role configures daemon.json - which results in iptables rules
being implemented - but not removed on docker engine restart.

Closes-Bug: #1923203

Change-Id: Ib1faa092e0b8f0668d1752490a34d0c2165d58d2
(cherry picked from commit bc96179195de171a693b83405a472dddda596bff)

commit_message:
[nova] Transition Train to EM

This transition the train branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: Ic0bca9ee68ccae7d0d17548d2472eb49c3c76968

commit_message:
Fix the issue of creating volume from image for vmware

In the vmware environment, if we create a volume from an image, there is no need
 to create an empty volume, otherwise an error will be reported that the target
volume already exists.

Signed-off-by: ZijianGuo <guozijn@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ibae773dd3bd185f74c37709ee396049d2b627b74

problems in the latest document

commit_message:
Point ipa-builder to stable/wallaby

Since ironic-python-agent-bulder has stable branches starting from
wallaby, we need to point all the older branches to stable/wallaby,
unless they're already pinned to an older version.

Also fix docs building job.

Change-Id: Ie752f2bd160a09b39e3ca6c2a76d194d6ae78f5f

subject: CI: Collect a snapshot of network connections
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-01-12 21:54:06.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/ironic-jobs.yaml', 'playbooks/ci-workarounds/get_extra_logging.yaml', 'playbooks/ci-workarounds/get_tftpd.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/d44b3b6fec932fc79ffa5de4ded98d6110d69ef1', 'message': "CI: Collect a snapshot of network connections

A recent magnum bug (https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2008494)
when running with uwsgi has yielded an interesting question if Ironic
is orphaning rpc clients or not. Ironic's code is slightly different
but also very similar, and similar bugs have been observed in the past
where the python garbage collection never cleans up the old connection
objects and effectively orphans the connection.

So we should likely at least try to collect some of the information
so we can determine if this is the case in our CI jobs. Hence this
change and attempt to collect that data after running CI.

Change-Id: I4e80c56449c0b3d07b160ae6c933a7a16c63c5c5
"}]
commit_message:
CI: Collect a snapshot of network connections

A recent magnum bug (https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2008494)
when running with uwsgi has yielded an interesting question if Ironic
is orphaning rpc clients or not. Ironic's code is slightly different
but also very similar, and similar bugs have been observed in the past
where the python garbage collection never cleans up the old connection
objects and effectively orphans the connection.

So we should likely at least try to collect some of the information
so we can determine if this is the case in our CI jobs. Hence this
change and attempt to collect that data after running CI.

Change-Id: I4e80c56449c0b3d07b160ae6c933a7a16c63c5c5

commit_message:
Add support to use config-drive

Add support to explicitly request config-drive
for BMC and Undercloud type instances.

NOTE: config-drive is always disabled for the
virtual barmetal intances. This is already hard
coded in virtual-baremetal-servers.yaml and
virtual-baremetal-servers-volume.yaml.

Related-Bug: #1929384
Closes-Bug: #1929419
Change-Id: I1f6454363b5d8a5c325afe194ed1484ff618f729
(cherry picked from commit 306ec29aec8a716e49cf0fd70e240aea8c7dc1d7)

commit_message:
Support forbidden template URL regexes

By setting a list of disallowed regexes for template URL, this feature
can avoid malicious attacker guessing the internal address and the
open port.

Change-Id: Ifb4910fc5629d977e5b89fbc81db14d56683139f

commit_message:
Allow migrating PMEM's data

This spec will be make the instance support code migrate if it allocate PMEM devices.

Change-Id: Id858f50c3804f9d60e1e79c3c3a042d508667f5d
Implements: blueprint allow-migrate-pmem-data
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/63/785563/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================================== Smartnic Management Overall Design =================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/copying-pmem-devices-data This spec proposes an method for copying PMEM Namespace's data of instance when cold migrating or resizing instance. Problem description =================== Currently, cold migrate or resize instance could make the PMEM Namespaces different on host, which is a PMEM Device for the instance. But the instance's data in the PMEM Device will lose. So i want to copy the data of pmem devices for instance when cold migrating or resizing the instance. As following: 1.The instance use /dev/dax0.0 PMEM Namespace on host. 2.After cold migrate or resize instance, the PMEM Namespace is /dev/dax0.1 on host or other host. 3.Copy the data from /dev/dax0.0 to /dev/dax0.1 . Use Cases --------- * Users want to copy the data on PMEM Namespace when cold migrating or resizing instance. Otherwise, the data for instance on PMEM Namespace will lose. Proposed change =============== When migrating or resizing intance, we can get the old PMEM device and the new PMEM device from `instance.migration_context`. So we can copy the data from old PMEM device to new PMEM device. Workflow -------- When migrating or resizing intance, we can get the old PMEM device and the new PMEM device from `instance.migration_context`. So we can copy the data from old PMEM device on source_compute to new PMEM device on dest_compute. colde migrating or resizing instance workflow as following: 1.The resize_instance operation is on source_compute, free the network volume etc. resources. 2.The finish_resize operation is on dest_compute, launching a new instance with resources in step1. 3.The confirm_resize operation is on source_compute, cleaning the residual resources of the instance. In step3, the PMEM devices' data will cleanup. Before cleanup, we can copy the data from old PMEM device to new PMEM device. After copying operation, we can cleanup the data of old PMEM device. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Upgrade impact -------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- QIU FOSSEN(qiujunting@inspur.com) Feature Liaison --------------- None Work Items ---------- Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Documentation Impact ==================== Need to add documentation. References ========== History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Wallaby - Introduced * - Xena - Reproposed

commit_message:
Add socat listen backend to clustercheck service

Allow clustercheck to be started on-demand by either socat or
xinetd. T-h-t configures the backend to be run by Kolla at
container start.

Change-Id: Ie7ede82a755e729d66e077f97e87b3d6c816ed3c
Related-Bug: #1928693

added_lines: # configuration used by the galera resource agent, # and by the clustercheck service when it is configured # to listen via socat if is_ipv6_address($bind_address) { $socat_listen_type = 'tcp6-listen' } else { $socat_listen_type = 'tcp4-listen' }MYSQL_HOST=localhost\n TRIPLEO_SOCAT_BIND='${socat_listen_type}:9200,bind=\"${bind_address}\",reuseaddr,fork'\n", } # configuration used when clustercheck is run via xinet
deleted_lines: MYSQL_HOST=localhost\n", } # the clustercheck service is run via xinet in the container

commit_message:
Mariadb shards documentation

Change-Id: Id9a24c54db9a70c777e51ea10504159d5090f9a7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/72/785172/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _mariadb-shards: ================ MariaDB Shards ================ A database shard, or simply a shard, is a horizontal partition of data in a database or search engine. Each shard is held on a separate database server/cluster, to spread load. Some data within a database remains present in all shards, but some appears only in a single shard. Each shard acts as the single source for this subset of data. Kolla supports sharding on service's database level, so every database can be hosted on different shard while accessible through ``kolla_internal_vip_address``. This documentation only explains the part where mariadb role installs that shards and how to configure it. Another part of implementation is defined in ProxySQL documentation HERE <TODO in followup patches>. This setup can be used also without ProxySQL, just to deploy MariaDB clusters simultaneously for whatever reason user want to do it (for example cells). Deployment ~~~~~~~~~~ In order to deploy several MariaDB cluster, you will need to edit inventory file in way described below: #. Add ``mariadb_shard_id`` hostvar to hosts which are members of common cluster (shard) as it is in example below: .. code-block:: ini [mariadb] server1ofcluster0 server2ofcluster0 server1ofcluster1 mariadb_shard_id=1 server2ofcluster1 mariadb_shard_id=1 server1ofcluster2 mariadb_shard_id=2 server2ofcluster2 mariadb_shard_id=2 .. note:: If ``mariadb_shard_id`` is not defined for host in inventory file it will be set automatically to ``mariadb_default_database_shard_id`` (default 0) from ``group_vars/all.yml`` and can be overwritten in ``/etc/kolla/globals.yml``. Shard which is marked as default is special in case of backup or loadbalance, as it is described below. Loadbalancer ------------ Kolla currently supports balancing only for default shard. This will be changed in future by replacement of HAProxy with ProxySQL. This results in certain limitations as described below. Backup and restore ------------------ Backup and restore is working only for default shard as kolla currently using HAProxy solution for MariaDB loadbalancer which is simple TCP and has configured only default shard hosts as backends, therefore backup script will reach only default shard on ``kolla_internal_vip_address``.

commit_message:
Use internal API for Barbican communication

This is a partial backport of two commits -
I6a174468bd91d214c08477b93c88032a45c137be and
I056f3eebcf87bcbaaf89fdd0dc1f46d143db7785. It includes the
barbican_endpoint_type option, but excludes the verify_ssl_file option,
since openstack_cacert is not used in configuration files in Train.

Change-Id: I1c5790fd4717d12e8ff8ddbcabfa8f0ece8411e0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/63/771863/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% if enable_barbican | bool %} [barbican] auth_endpoint = {{ keystone_internal_url }} barbican_endpoint_type = internal {% endif %}

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-11-08 01:21:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/7873118e92e97591f82aea8a0ae3a3c73a8320a1', 'message': 'Update pci stat pools based on PCI device changes

At start up of nova-compute service, the PCI stat pools are
populated based on information in pci_devices table in Nova
database. The pools are updated only when new device is added
or removed but not on any device changes like device type.

If an existing device is configured as SRIOV and nova-compute
is restarted, the pci_devices table gets updated but the device

commit_message:
Update pci stat pools based on PCI device changes

At start up of nova-compute service, the PCI stat pools are
populated based on information in pci_devices table in Nova
database. The pools are updated only when new device is added
or removed but not on any device changes like device type.

If an existing device is configured as SRIOV and nova-compute
is restarted, the pci_devices table gets updated but the device
is still listed under the old pool in pci_tracker.stats.pool
(in-memory object).

This patch looks for device type updates in existing devices
and updates the pools accordingly.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/functional/libvirt/test_pci_sriov_servers.py
    nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/fakelibvirt.py

The functional test requires to skip the capabilities of pci
device. This can be done by getting capability template out of
pci_dev_template [1] which is introduced by commit
b927748c257e705903c2aa0ffa47b19914e31ede. Not able to clean
backport the mentioned commit and so removed funtional test
case.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/commit/b0a451d4289dae2086b730fde6b0c7b30f3da2e8/nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/fakelibvirt.py#L186

Change-Id: Id4ebb06e634a612c8be4be6c678d8265e0b99730
Closes-Bug: #1892361
(cherry picked from commit b8695de6da56db42b83b9d9d4c330148766644be)
(cherry picked from commit d8b8a8193b6b8228f6e7d6bde68b5ea6bb53dd8b)
(cherry picked from commit f58399cf496566e39d11f82a61e0b47900f2eafa)
(cherry picked from commit 8378785f995dd4bec2a5a20f7bf5946b3075120d)
(cherry picked from commit 73e631862a81e85fdf9305f3d15b201d780c8743)

added_lines: def _get_pool_with_device_type_mismatch(self, dev): """Check for device type mismatch in the pools for a given device. Return (pool, device) if device type does not match or a single None if the device type matches. """ for pool in self.pools: for device in pool['devices']: if device.address == dev.address: if dev.dev_type != pool["dev_type"]: return pool, device return None return None def update_device(self, dev): """Update a device to its matching pool.""" pool_device_info = self._get_pool_with_device_type_mismatch(dev) if pool_device_info is None: return pool, device = pool_device_info pool['devices'].remove(device) self._decrease_pool_count(self.pools, pool) self.add_device(dev)

commit_message:
CI: Configure IP on a linux bridge instead of OVS br-ex

OVS upgrade jobs failed due to assigning an IP on the br-ex interface
(which is recycled during OVS upgrade). This change introduces a bridge
and veth pair for Neutron to use.

Change-Id: Ib3bee6e810fb8d31552d4c72c2a1ccae382c51f0
(cherry picked from commit 337771143ba7c392665a14e8aa2434817d9e9473)

commit_message:
remove the oslo_utils.fnmatch

Oslo.utils's fnmatch module was added to fix the py2.7 fnmatch module
who was not thread safe [1]. Python 2.7 is no longer supported so now we
can use the stdlib's fnmatch module and deprecate the one of oslo.utils.

[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue23191$

Change-Id: I94dcc34180d2b31ce7f9050d1a289a5793b5f26f

commit_message:
db: Remove 'cinder.database.migration_backend' entrypoint

We don't provide multiple backends in-tree and couldn't possibly support
those provided out-of-tree. Remove this knob.

Change-Id: Ia05eb6536bd4b2977358c0086293757091aa5e68
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Erroneous formula of virtual free capacity

This patch supplies weight of max_over_subscription_ratio
for reserved capacity when thin provisioning support is
satisfied so that reserved_percentage flag becomes effective
for pools which support thin provisioning.

Closes-Bug: #1927330
Change-Id: Ifad639b29ef628d467011e50fbd97e4af820c4c1

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I52921f9da9685f1599da090011153147157a7a91
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/92/790892/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Drop OVS support

We're no longer maintaining the Windows OVS port.

Normally, we'd go through the standard deprecation policy but
since the Neutron OVS agent no longer runs on Windows at all since
Wallaby, we're dropping it right away.

Change-Id: I54c681c29c80f1d537e38980f68717b72f6b215b

commit_message:
Bump requirements

The lower constraints job is failing as Nova has bumped the
oslo.config minimum requirement. We'll do the same.

The nova conf fixture has been moved so we'll have to pick that up
as well.

commit_message:
Bump requirements

The lower constraints job is failing as Nova has bumped the
oslo.config minimum requirement. We'll do the same.

The nova conf fixture has been moved so we'll have to pick that up
as well.

Change-Id: I1907982ca8ffc81b2529af22a9a6fd4a55aecafb

commit_message:
sharding: Improve rows_per_shard auto feature

This patch adds an extra level of smarts to the sharder. Which will
check to see how many objects are left when scanning for shardranges. If
there will be a smaller range at the very end it'll adjust the
rows_per_shard for all yet to be found shardranges to absorb the small
shard.

Currently the broker only corrects the last 2. Every other will be
shard_container_threshold // 2, ie:

   500k, 500k, 500k, 510k

or:

  500k, 500k, 5ook, 255k, 255k

Which this patch, it would be more like:

 502500, 502500, 502500, 502500

Change-Id: Ie6ffe8411155251284fbbe2565578fb5128cbd70
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/40/791340/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import mathdef get_rows_per_shard(rows_per_shard, shard_container_threshold, expansion_limit, obj_count): if rows_per_shard != 'auto': return rows_per_shard # we have an auto. So let's calculate the best. rows_per_shard = shard_container_threshold // 2 if rows_per_shard > expansion_limit or rows_per_shard > obj_count: return rows_per_shard left_over = obj_count % rows_per_shard number_of_shards = obj_count // rows_per_shard max_extra_per_shard = (expansion_limit - rows_per_shard) * number_of_shards if left_over < max_extra_per_shard: rows_per_shard += math.ceil(left_over / number_of_shards) return rows_per_shard # rows_per_shard = rows_per_shard_percent * shard_container_threshold or # auto. 'rows_per_shard': 'auto', def auto_int_value(val): return config_auto_int_value(val, 'auto') ('rows_per_shard', auto_int_value, 'rows_per_shard', False), obj_count = broker.get_info().get('object_count', 0) rows_per_shard = get_rows_per_shard(self.rows_per_shard, self.shard_container_threshold, self.expansion_limit, obj_count)

commit_message:
Octavia: Add support for build_rate_limit

This change introcudes a new parameter to set the build_rate_limit
parameter in Octavia.

Octavia doesn't set a limit by default (the default is -1) but to avoid
boot storm triggred by some failure patterns like netowork outage,
the default is overridden by 1.

Change-Id: I21667af35f761eaf41281b032ede728327cf42b3

commit_message:
Add support to use config-drive

Add support to explicitly request config-drive
for BMC and Undercloud type instances.

NOTE: config-drive is always disabled for the
virtual barmetal intances. This is already hard
coded in virtual-baremetal-servers.yaml and
virtual-baremetal-servers-volume.yaml.

Related-Bug: #1929384
Closes-Bug: #1929419
Change-Id: I1f6454363b5d8a5c325afe194ed1484ff618f729

commit_message:
Change default network backend driver to ML2/OVN

This patch is changing the default network backend driver in DevStack to
OVN.

This is a long effort from the Neutron community that has been
discussed on previous PTGs and agreed upon.

A similar patch to this one [0] have been merged in the past but got
reverted [1] because it did break some zuul jobs. This one also include
fixes for such jobs and was verified at [2]

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/735097
[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/775632
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/zuul/zuul-jobs/+/791117

Change-Id: I8c2be82f33ed9f6c36f5509b3b210ee1a38e87ca
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/36/791436/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-05-24 13:23:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/c69f1ef1434f00db6ada09104fa26e1d63edc914', 'message': "Individual content types for multi form upload

When uploading multiple files through the form upload middleware
it would take the first file's content type and encoding and wrongly

however would also set their 'Content-Type' and 'Content-Encoding'

commit_message:
Individual content types for multi form upload

When uploading multiple files through the form upload middleware
it would take the first file's content type and encoding and wrongly
apply it to all the uploaded files.

This was because there was a shared 'attributes' dict for all body parts
which was (correctly) filled from all the non-file parts. The file parts
however would also set their 'Content-Type' and 'Content-Encoding'
header values in the attributes dict.

The content type/encoding handling made sure to not overwrite
existing values in the dict. Thus the first file to specify such a
header value would win.

Now the individual files get their own content types/encodings by
applying the file part content type/encoding headers only to a copy
of the dict.

The file parts' headers continue to be ignored if they are overridden
by explicit 'content-type'/'content-encoding' body parts.

Closes-Bug: #1916017
Change-Id: I0a921afc481ef5b98cd5974c45d4b1d3e2a15731

commit_message:
Remove old deprecated Token clients

TokenClientJSON and V3TokenClientJSON were deprecated
very long back so its time to remove them.

No one in OpenStack using those
- https://codesearch.opendev.org/?q=TokenClientJSON&i=nope&files=&excludeFiles=&repos=

Change-Id: If20fa58e64e130e268e1ad7999b0088a0a0c0f9c

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I7112c11085d646e17fa2beb792a0aeed0d56e66b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-role-chrony refs/changes/99/789499/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

This patch removes a conditional check in the update_router() method
which was verifying if snat was enabled in order to update the nat
rules. This check does not make sense in the update method as if snat
was disabled we should still call update_nat_rules() which will then
remove the NAT entry from the OVN NB DB.

Change-Id: Ice20d22365acaf33ee211b1e38b7d0bc151c1ba8
Closes-Bug: #1922089

'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Fix: Disabling snat after it was enabled

This patch removes a conditional check in the update_router() method
which was verifying if snat was enabled in order to update the nat
rules. This check does not make sense in the update method as if snat
was disabled we should still call update_nat_rules() which will then
remove the NAT entry from the OVN NB DB.

Change-Id: Ice20d22365acaf33ee211b1e38b7d0bc151c1ba8
Closes-Bug: #1922089
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit ddc8e625f714aebd65a454f23fedc6d9a9320e89)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/38/792538/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Unpin cmd2 package in pip

The cmd2 package was pinned in order to maintain compatability,
however quite a bit of time has passed since doing so. This change
unpins cmd2 to use the latest version.

Change-Id: I2b9c8d4c1da91b55301d818861d29cccb64b28cd

commit_message:
Update all jobs to at least Train

With the removal of official support of all openstack releases
older than T, this change updates each job to at least use the
Train release.

Change-Id: I6b41d79495a74b1072995ae5036f56bfbf585c25

commit_message:
Remove gerritbot from channels with no discussion

Auditing IRC channels we log for non-bot comments in all of 2021,
there are some channels with none but which still have our Gerrit
bot reporting in them. On the assumption that these channels are
truly dead/unwatched, stop reporting changes in them for now.

Change-Id: I9625d58b7d64c7d367f86c139f2264019ef75d22

commit_message:
Remove misleading section from upgrade docs

The openstack-helm docs currently state that the openstack-helm
dev team will work with Helm with regards to facilitating job upgrades.

This is misleading in that we do not directly contribute to Helm and
currently provide methods for charts to run jobs for an upgrade
for instances where images are updated, the job is deleted and
re-ran.

Change-Id: If04367b6563ed36c3b3cde7a9cd4425b6795505f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/58/791858/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: or are still in flight. An example of where this behavior would be desirable is when an updated db\_sync image has updated to point from a Mitaka image to a Newton image. In this case, the operator will likely want a db\_sync job, which was already run and completed during site installation, to run again with the updated image to bring the schema inline with the Newton release.
deleted_lines: or are still in flight. OpenStack-Helm developers will continue to work with the Helm community or develop charts that will support job removal prior to an upgrade, which will recreate services with updated images. An example of where this behavior would be desirable is when an updated db\_sync image has updated to point from a Mitaka image to a Newton image. In this case, the operator will likely want a db\_sync job, which was already run and completed during site installation, to run again with the updated image to bring the schema inline with the Newton release.

commit_message:
image_meta: Provide image_ref as the id when fetching from instance

At present various users of instance.image_meta expect it to be a fully
populated ImageMeta object. However when the instance is pulled from the
database the ImageMeta object is only partially populated via
instance.system_metadata with a limited set of attributes such as
min_ram, min_disk, disk_format and container_format. This can result in
NotImplementedErrors being raised by o.vo as seen in bug #1928063 when
an attempt is made to access common attributes such as id or name.

To avoid this the id is now provided by instance.image_ref when
available.

The majority of the change is test fallout and ensuring that valid UUIDs
are provided as instance.image_ref and used by instance.image_meta.

Related-Bug: #1928063
Change-Id: I55d66c3a6cbd50da90065f4a58f77b5cd29ce9ea

commit_message:
network-data-v2 - baremetal provision networks

Extend the '_baremetal_provision' book to include
details on how to enable management of network ports
and applying network configuration to provisioned nodes
as part of the node provisioning.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/772977
Change-Id: I6d8f6447565779b5892d1b8c5c057c9a81a56df4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/55/779355/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: In the Wallaby release the baremetal provisining was extended to also manage the neutron API resources for :doc:`../features/network_isolation` and :doc:`../features/custom_networks`, and apply network configuration on the provisioned nodes using os-net-config. When using :doc:`../features/network_isolation`, :doc:`../features/custom_networks` or a combination of the two the **networks** and **network_configuration** must either be set in the ``defaults`` for the role or for each specific node (instance). The following example extends the first simple configuration example adding typical TripleO network isolation by setting defaults for each role .. code-block:: yaml - name: Controller count: 3 defaults: networks: - network: ctlplane subnet: ctlplane-subnet vif: true - network: external subnet: external_subnet - network: internalapi subnet: internal_api_subnet01 - network: storage subnet: storage_subnet01 - network: storagemgmt subnet: storage_mgmt_subnet01 - network: tenant subnet: tenant_subnet01 network_config: template: /home/stack/nic-config/controller.j2 default_route_network: - external - name: Compute count: 100 defaults: networks: - network: ctlplane subnet: ctlplane-subnet vif: true - network: internalapi subnet: internal_api_subnet02 - network: tenant subnet: tenant_subnet02 - network: storage subnet: storage_subnet02 network_config: template: /home/stack/nic-config/compute.j2 These properties serve three purposes:* Setting network configuration properties for the deployed nodes * ``nics``: (**DEPRECATED:** Replaced by ``networks`` in Wallaby) List of dicts representing requested NICs. See :ref:`nics-properties` * ``networks``: List of dicts representing instance networks. See :ref:`networks-properties` * ``network_config``: Network configuration details. See :ref:`network-config-properties` .. _networks-properties: Networks Properties ___________________ The ``instances`` ``networks`` property supports a list of dicts, one dict per network. * ``network``: Neutron network to create the port for this network: * ``fixed_ip``: Specific IP address to use for this network * ``network``: Neutron network to create the port for this network * ``subnet``: Neutron subnet to create the port for this network * ``port``: Existing Neutron port to use instead of creating one * ``vif``: When ``true`` the network is attached as VIF (virtual-interface) by metalsmith/ironic. When ``false`` the baremetal provisioning workflow creates the Neutron API resource, but no VIF attachment happens in metalsmith/ironic. (Typically only the provisioning network (``ctlplane``) has this set to ``true``.) By default there is one network representing .. code-block:: yaml - network: ctlplane vif: true Other valid network entries would be .. code-block:: yaml - network: ctlplane fixed_ip: 192.168.24.8 vif: true - port: overcloud-controller-0-ctlplane - network: internal_api subnet: internal_api_subnet01 .. _network-config-properties: Network Config Properties _________________________ The ``network_config`` property contains os-net-config related properties. * ``template``: The ansible j2 nic config template to use when applying node network configuration. (default: ``templates/net_config_bridge.j2``) * ``physical_bridge_name``: Name of the OVS bridge to create for accessing external networks. (default: ``br-ex``) * ``public_interface_name``: Which interface to add to the public bridge (default: ``nic1``) * ``network_deployment_actions``: When to apply network configuration changes, allowed values are CREATE and UPDATE. (default: ``CREATE``) * ``net_config_data_lookup``: Per node and/or per node group os-net-config nic mapping config. * ``default_route_network``: The network to use for the default route (default: ``ctlplane``) * ``networks_skip_config``: List of networks that should be skipped when configuring node networking * ``dns_search_domains``: A list of DNS search domains to be added (in order) to resolv.conf. * ``bond_interface_ovs_options``: The ovs_options or bonding_options string for the bond interface. Set things like lacp=active and/or bond_mode=balance-slb for OVS bonds or like mode=4 for Linux bonds using this option. server environment file is ``~/overcloud-baremetal-deployed.yaml``. It also assumes overcloud networks are pre-deployed using the ``openstack overcloud network provision`` command and the deployed networks environment file is ``~/overcloud-networks-deployed.yaml``. --network-ports \.. note:: Removing the ``--network-ports`` argument will disable the management of non-VIF networks and post node provisioning network configuration with os-net-config via ansible. -e ~/overcloud-networks-deployed.yaml \ --network-ports \.. note:: Removing the ``--network-ports`` argument will disable the management of non-VIF networks, non-VIF ports will _not_ be deleted in that case.
deleted_lines: These properties serve two purposes:* ``nics``: List of dicts representing requested NICs. See :ref:`nics-properties`server environment file is ``~/overcloud-baremetal-deployed.yaml``

When ceph_nfs_rados_backend is provided, as per doc [1], for a fresh
setup, we need to make sure to create the Ganesha export index object
as an empty object before starting the Ganesha server.
This change provides the two tasks, already present in ceph-ansible,
to create the index object.
In addition, since the ganesha systemd units are managed by pacemaker,

commit_message:
Create ganesha-export-index before the ceph-nfs daemon is deployed

When ceph_nfs_rados_backend is provided, as per doc [1], for a fresh
setup, we need to make sure to create the Ganesha export index object
as an empty object before starting the Ganesha server.
This change provides the two tasks, already present in ceph-ansible,
to create the index object.
In addition, since the ganesha systemd units are managed by pacemaker,
this change renders the related j2 templates and prepares the ganesha
workdir in the ceph-nfs target hosts.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/manila/latest/contributor/ganesha.html
[2] https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/blob/master/roles/ceph-nfs/tasks/start_nfs.yml#L15-L31

Change-Id: Ie89c35238d1bb82a28d560d7f0f718f7ee38044f

commit_message:
Remove volume v1 service clients

Cinder has removed the volume v1 APIs in queens
cycle: I03bf2db5bd7e2fdfb4f6032758ccaf2b348a82ba

Tempest does not support queens release so we are good
to remove the volume v1 service clients also.

Change-Id: I297f230de51e0ef4f35eb33ddbaaab53c230713f

commit_message:
Change image key name for blackbox exporter

This ps change the key name for the blackbox exporter so that
it is consistent with the naming convention of other prometheus
exporters.

Co-authored-by: Chi Lo <cl566n@att.com>

Change-Id: Ia190aa6730fab99d7fb14c53b538c72a1bc698ce

commit_message:
Remove credential_cleanup job in keystone chart

Before the various helm hooks were added, a credential cleanup job
was created in order to handle the cleanup of the database should
the keystone credentials secrets get deleted. With the new hooks
added that make the secrets persist on upgrading, this job is not
really needed anymore.

Change-Id: Ic9eb5d30784dd8a9f2f8cc719155b92bc7c1c6db

commit_message:
[OVN] Fix: Disabling snat after it was enabled

This patch removes a conditional check in the update_router() method
which was verifying if snat was enabled in order to update the nat
rules. This check does not make sense in the update method as if snat
was disabled we should still call update_nat_rules() which will then
remove the NAT entry from the OVN NB DB.

Change-Id: Ice20d22365acaf33ee211b1e38b7d0bc151c1ba8
Closes-Bug: #1922089
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit ddc8e625f714aebd65a454f23fedc6d9a9320e89)

commit_message:
[OVN] Fix: Disabling snat after it was enabled

This patch removes a conditional check in the update_router() method
which was verifying if snat was enabled in order to update the nat
rules. This check does not make sense in the update method as if snat
was disabled we should still call update_nat_rules() which will then
remove the NAT entry from the OVN NB DB.

Change-Id: Ice20d22365acaf33ee211b1e38b7d0bc151c1ba8
Closes-Bug: #1922089
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit ddc8e625f714aebd65a454f23fedc6d9a9320e89)

commit_message:
Fix name of networking-ansible/baremetal package

We should install python3-* instead of python2-* in CentOS8.
This change fixes the remaining usage of python2-* left for
netwokring-ansible and networking-baremetal.

Backport note:
This includes 260aa9fe292646f553467cc6b63475261fed9b54 which fixed
the wrong package names in unit tests.

Conflicts:
	manifests/plugins/ml2/networking_ansible.pp
	spec/classes/neutron_plugins_ml2_networking_ansible_spec.rb
	spec/classes/neutron_plugins_ml2_networking_baremetal_spec.rb

Change-Id: I136a81cc857130b3befa5df204525bfa6c6f0206
(cherry picked from commit 34b5036ed8a1b7d7b50ec85484f496d861be57bf)
(cherry picked from commit ca266112909fdd15f1c90c2778238bb66ff6c491)

commit_message:
Use kubeadm for installing Kubernetes on devstack.

Till now, for installing kuryr-kubernetes and one of the crucial service
- kubernetes, there has been used manual method for installing it in
specified version. Over time it became a burden to follow requirements
and constraints, therefore decision has been made to use recommended way
of installing Kubernetes - kubeadm. In this patch devstack installation
of the kuryr-kubernetes and its dependences has been heavily reworked.

Other than that, OpenShift related functions has been removed, since
they were all outdated and non-working for the long time.

Change-Id: Ife21874c0a71ba07723094c0f880aabcf5825b77

commit_message:
Deprecate image v1 service clients

Glance has removed the image v1 APIs in Victoria
cycle: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/glance/+/738673

Tempest still support Ussuri release which is last release
where image v1 APIs are present so we need to keep them until
stable ussuri is supported in Tempest but we can deprecate them.

Change-Id: Iabc02c4516c84b523c61b82a2a44ee0db73f21e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/42/792042/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- deprecations: - | Tempest service clients for image v1 APIs (tempest.lib.services.image.v1 module) is deprecated and will be removed once Tempest stop supporting stable Ussuri release which is last release Image v1 APIs are present in glance.

commit_message:
Clean port forwarding cache when router is DOWN

Port forwarding L3 agent extension needs to clean cache when
router is DOWN, otherwise the port forwarding extension will
skip all objects processing when router is UP again, because
the cache is hitting.

This patch addresses this issue.

Change-Id: Idd65f1eda020ada9a76c39904efa8d55680d9e6b
Closes-bug: #1917393
(cherry picked from commit 058214670820be6f40e8ab05c0e1dbe8dc389abc)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/78/779778/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch.object(pf.PortForwardingAgentExtension, '_sending_port_forwarding_fip_status') @mock.patch.object(iptables_manager.IptablesTable, 'add_rule') @mock.patch.object(iptables_manager.IptablesTable, 'add_chain') @mock.patch.object(l3router.RouterInfo, 'add_floating_ip') def test_add_delete_router(self, mock_add_fip, mock_add_chain, mock_add_rule, mock_send_fip_status): # simulate the router add and already there is a port forwarding # resource association. mock_add_fip.return_value = lib_const.FLOATINGIP_STATUS_ACTIVE self.fip_pf_ext.add_router(self.context, self.router) self._assert_called_iptables_process( mock_add_chain, mock_add_rule, mock_add_fip, mock_send_fip_status, target_obj=self.portforwarding1) router_fip_ids = self.fip_pf_ext.mapping.router_fip_mapping.get( self.router['id']) self.assertIsNotNone(router_fip_ids) for fip_id in router_fip_ids: pf_ids = self.fip_pf_ext.mapping.fip_port_forwarding.get(fip_id) self.assertIsNotNone(pf_ids) for pf_id in pf_ids: pf = self.fip_pf_ext.mapping.managed_port_forwardings.get( pf_id) self.assertIsNotNone(pf) self.fip_pf_ext.delete_router(self.context, self.router) self.assertIsNone( self.fip_pf_ext.mapping.router_fip_mapping.get(self.router['id']))

commit_message:
CI: Configure IP on a linux bridge instead of OVS br-ex

OVS upgrade jobs failed due to assigning an IP on the br-ex interface
(which is recycled during OVS upgrade). This change introduces a bridge
and veth pair for Neutron to use.

Change-Id: Ib3bee6e810fb8d31552d4c72c2a1ccae382c51f0

commit_message:
Skip device deletion if in a temporaty namespace

In "IpLibTestFramework" tests, skip the device deletion if it has
been created in a temporary namespace. It will be removed
automatically when the namespace is deleted.

Trivial-Fix

Change-Id: I3936a17499efec8d2d8349768517d7bc4b65bdbe
